intro: Melampyrum caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it partially relies on its host plants for water and nutrients. The plant features slender, erect stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to orange, with a distinctive bilabiate structure. It is native to the Caucasus region and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
